Event.name: Lending
Event.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Lender</fen> gives the <fen>Theme</fen> to the <fen>Borrower</fen> with the expectation that the <fen>Borrower</fen> will return the <fen>Theme</fen> to the <fen>Lender</fen> after a <fen>Duration</fen> of time. This frame differs from the Borrowing frame in that this frame profiles the Lender in active sentences, whereas the Borrowing frame profiles the Borrower. <ex></ex> For the time being, this frame includes both the transfer event itself and the end state of the event, as shown in the first two examples following:
<ex><fex name="Lender">I</fex> am <t>lending</t> <fex name="Borrower">a student of mine</fex> <fex name="Theme">my book on German modal particles</fex>.</ex>
<ex>The student has not yet given back <fex name="Theme">the book</fex> <fex name="Lender">I</fex> <t>lent</t> <fex name="Borrower">to him</fex>.</ex>
<ex>Not only did I have to borrow a gown, but <fex name="Borrower">I</fex> was also <t>lent</t> <fex name="Theme">a jacket</fex>! <fex name="Lender">CNI</fex></ex>
<ex><fex name="Lender">I</fex> <t>lent</t> <fex name="Borrower">my girlfriend</fex> <fex name="Theme">my car</fex> <fex name="Duration">for the weekend</fex>.</ex>
<ex><fex name="Lender">Jerry</fex> <t>loaned</t> <fex name="Theme">his skateboard</fex> <fex name="Borrower">to his little brother</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

Arg.name: Borrower
Arg.definition: <def-root>The person or institution who receives the <fen>Theme</fen> from the <fen>Lender</fen> for a <fen>Duration</fen>. <ex>I <t>lent</t> the book <fex name="Borr">to him</fex> for a whole month, and he still hasn't read it.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Duration
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The amout of time in which the <fen>Borrower</fen> has possession of the <fen>Theme</fen>.
<ex>I <t>lent</t> the book to him <fex name="Dur">for a whole month</fex>, and he still hasn't read it.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Lender
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The person or institution who gives the <fen>Theme</fen> to the <fen>Borrower</fen> for a <fen>Duration</fen>.
<ex><fex name="Lend">I</fex> <t>lent</t> the book to him for a whole month, and he still hasn't read it.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Theme
Arg.definition: <def-root>The object that is transferred from the <fen>Lender</fen> to the <fen>Borrower</fen> for a <fen>Duration</fen>. <ex>I <t>lent</t> <fex name="Th">the book</fex> to him for a whole month, and he still hasn't read it.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Purpose
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The aim of the <fen>Lender</fen> which they believe will be accomplished by lending the <fen>Theme</fen> to the <fen>Borrower</fen>.
<ex>His parents <t>lent</t> him money <fex name="Purp">to pay off his student loans</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The time when the lending event occurs.
<ex>I <t>lent</t> him my car <fex name="Time">on Friday</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The way in which the <fen>Lender</fen> lends the <fen>Theme</fen>.
<ex>Juan <t>lent</t> me the car <fex name="Man">reluctantly</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The location in which the Lender lends the <fen>Theme</fen> to the <fen>Borrower</fen>.
<ex>I <t>lent</t> him my book <fex name="Pla">in Dubai</fex>.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: lend.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to give somebody something temporarily

lexUnit.name: loan.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to give someone something temporarily

lexUnit.name: loan.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: an entity, usually money, given to somebody only temporarily
